function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wearable devices may not accurately capture and report the wearer's health status, leading to unreliable data.","Impact":"Inaccurate health status reporting can result in undetected disease spread and ineffective response measures.","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and validation of the wearable devices, and cross-referencing with clinical testing.","Technologies":"Biometric authentication, machine learning algorithms for health status detection.","People":"Employees, healthcare workers, general public.","Owner":"Manufacturers, healthcare providers, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Reliance on smartphone applications for real-time health data could lead to privacy and security risks.","Impact":"Data breaches or unauthorized access to health data, leading to privacy violations and potential misuse of sensitive information.","Mitigation":"Implement strong encryption methods, regular security updates, and user education on data privacy best practices.","Technologies":"End-to-end encryption, secure authentication protocols, data anonymization techniques.","People":"Wearable device users, healthcare workers, data security experts.","Owner":"App developers, wearable device manufacturers, data security professionals."},{"Description":"Improper disposal of the biosensor patches may lead to potential disease spread.","Impact":"Improper disposal could result in the spread of COVID-19 from contaminated patches, increasing the risk of transmission.","Mitigation":"Clear guidelines for safe disposal and handling, proper training of users, and environmentally friendly disposal options.","Technologies":"Biodegradable materials, waste management systems for medical devices.","People":"Wearable device users, healthcare workers, waste management personnel.","Owner":"Manufacturers, waste management companies, public health authorities."}]}
